Title:
Microstoma longipileum, sp nov. (Sarcoscyphaceae, Pezizales)
from Japan
Keywords:
endangered species, mycobiota, new species, ITS-5.8S,
phylogeny
Abstract:
Microstoma longipileum sp. nov. collected from two
locations in Japan was described. It is characterized by long apothecial
hairs and salmon pink discs. Molecular phylogenetic analyses supported
the novelty of this fungus. We additionally reported the overlooked
morphology of hyphal mats and phialides and conidia produced by
ascospores for the species. By addition of M. longipileum, now 6 species
of Microstoma are documented in Japan.
